results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: It was government policy for First Nations peoples in Australia to assimilate to the white ethics of education and work. Then came the mission stations, removal of children, forced labour often in the most deplorable conditions, exploitation and even when First Nations Australians were trained in skilled work through the mission stations, white Australians would not employ them - all this most comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film.
results.title_for_label: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History

group.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work

group_siblings.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
Projected Memories: Work in old films

results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

group_siblings.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
Never Done: Women, Work and History

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: The Village green
results.brief_description:
Vietnamese poet Huong Trieu worked with ACMI to produce a visual treatment of her poetry about village life in Vietnam. This was part of a VicHealth funded initiative.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

video_links.name: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about growing up on Lake Condah Aboriginal Mission. A local Elder, Uncle Kenny Saunders, visits the site of Lake Condah Mission and talks about his childhood memories revealing a past of cruelty and fear, and the devastation felt in the aftermath of the Eumerella massacres.
results.title_for_label: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

group_siblings.title: In this situation again = In this place again
Memories: a short walk with Aunty Maude

results.title: The Way I see things
results.brief_description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.
results.description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Sacrifice
results.brief_description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.
